lexUnit.name: stalk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stride in a proud, stiff, or angry manner

sentence.text: Our meeting then broke up , Mandeville stalking back into the hall whilst we returned to our chambers .
I stalked out of the hall , quite pleased with myself , and went back to my own chamber .
As Ginsberg read out one of the Russian 's works , the writer himself stalked out of the hall .
With which she stalked across the back of the hall to her little parlour opposite , and slammed herself into it .
With which she stalked past him and into the hall without so much as a backward glance at Theda , standing by the desk , a look of new hope in her eyes .
I stalked back into the room and brushed my hair furiously , counting the strokes .
While the Doctor stalked about the room , or fiddled with the door , or argued with the guards , the three others had sat on the floor and exchanged their stories .
With a parting glare , Ursula stalked from the room , leaving Maurice to fold the map shut and smile across at Charlotte .
She stalked into the teachers ' room and returned with her cane .
Her skirt swirled around her legs in a froth of black lace as she stalked across the room .
` I 'll get undressed , " she muttered and stalked off behind a bush .
Finally , my temper spent , I stalked away .
Keith seemed consumed by rage ; he stalked about the house , talking to himself and looking at her occasionally with a red , homicidal fury .
Anthea stalked across the car park of Randall Lodge like a woman with a purpose .
After a moment , she spun on her heel and stalked across the platform to the door that led to the large communal dressing-room .
Draining his beer , he stalked from the bar .
Amanda stalked into the kitchen and plugged in the kettle .
Dana fended her off , stalking past her into the living-room .
With as much dignity as she could muster , she stalked past him into the bathroom .
I stalked amongst the booths and ramshackle dwellings built against the wall .
` Back to Milan , " she snapped as she stalked to the door .
Leif turned away , retching , whilst Cranston stalked out of his house muttering vengeance against all and sundry .
She stalked , stiff-legged like a wolf , into the darkling garden and like a wolf she sniffed the air .
Then , making a soft purring sound she scattered a handful of maize kernels on to the ground in front of her and the hens stuck out their necks and stalked across .
She struggled from Sophia 's embrace and jumped down among the windfall apples , rolled one over with her paw , then turned and stalked indifferently away among the Michaelmas daisies .
Pushing rudely past Ellie , she stalked upstairs .
Mary , Queen of Scots , turned on her majestic heel and stalked off stage , her head held high .
So I turned on my heel and stalked away to the control area
He did n't like the microphone and had to be cajoled into using it , he stalked up and down the front of the hall quoting from cuttings on the Vietnam War , and was heard by few .
" Nothing in all this , " said Baynes , stalking , candle in hand , from room to room .
